timeline.bodyText: if we do not use this request for editing credential, only for creation, then ResourceObjectField annotation is not needed, since for creation we are using other permission to check and it is defined on method of the controller
timeline.author: horadla23
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -18,6 +24,13 @@
 @JsonInclude(Include.NON_NULL)
 public class CredentialRequest extends CredentialBase {
 
+    @Size(max = 100, min = 5, message = "The length of the credential's name has to be in range of 5 to 100")
+    @Pattern(regexp = "(^[a-z][-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9]$)",
+            message = "The name of the credential can only contain lowercase alphanumeric characters and hyphens and has start with an alphanumeric character")
+    @ApiModelProperty(value = ModelDescriptions.NAME, required = true, allowableValues = "length range[5, 100]")
+    @ResourceObjectField(action = AuthorizationResourceAction.EDIT_CREDENTIAL, variableType = AuthorizationVariableType.NAME)

timeline.message: CB-9296 Creating a new edit credential object for put requests because in case of audit credential we are using a uuid and we would like to avoid the unnecessary validation on the name object in case of put
